name: kneejerk
text: Blister tells it like it is.

name: deimosrising
text: He's already dead. He has nothing to fear. Science will not let Nice Pete kill him again.

name: nasir
text: Precisely why it is what we need more of.

name: zefiel
text: Zero-G Stephen Hawking approves, seemingly.

name: stuart
text: To fully appreciate this comment, advance 9 strips.

name: charchar
text: Science means not all dreams can come true!

name: evilbobikus
text: I wouldn't put it past him, Nice Pete and his kin have neither fear nor even understanding on this science .

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Don't be so sure. Nice Pete is nothing if not creative in his destructiveness.

name: saint
text: Is there anything sadder? Ask Lie Bot.

name: hadakang
text: I always really enjoyed the fact that despite being from heaven blister is just a big asshole generally

name: gothfae
text: Seems to be a squirrel thing.

name: petitegitan
text: I have seen them spend hours messing with my dog. This comment is 100% true.

name: ebessan
text: Ricky Nihoha seems like a pretty good dude as long as you don't steal all of his homemade bean salad.

name: zem
text: to be honest i completely agree with him in this strip

name: whuppins
text: Blister is the most underrated Achewood character.

name: deancain29
text: Blister is a mix of Todd and Lyle... with a little Ted Danson? who's with me?

name: ih8jonmayr
text: I've always thought of Blister as Todd, just without a heartbeat or a cocaine addiction.

name: tinhand
text:
Blisters line in the last panel is just great. It's a shame we don't see more of him.
I haven't read any (either) of Nice Petes books. Are they good?
Also; there's no real reason for any of Achewoods characters to fear death. If we've learnt anything from Roast Beef, it's that Achewoods characters are pretty much impossible to kill since they either come back to life or down to earth anyway.

name: ezcmac
text:
Blister's imperviousness to physical danger lends him a swagger which no other character can duplicate.

Even Todd is reduced to Nice Pete's "Yes Man."

name: mcwee
text: Man, Blister swings from the shoulder with a two-by-four; my shit is humbled, man; raw out humbled.

name: woodenteeth
text: A comment left by woodenteeth was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, farqussus, Zem, I_Love_Kate)

name: direhaggis
text: Blister just wants to gamble. Distractions are not wanted.

name: jesler729
text: Oh man even Todd is unsettled by Blister.

name: feetnotes
text: You'd better believe that Blister has got wicked sack.

name: riazm
text: Dude, could there be anything creepier than playing poker with Nice fuckin' Pete?

name: dovey
text: Listening to Nice Pete's bible fanfic is creepier.

name: riazm
text: Could you imagine trying to bluff whilst Pete looks you in the eye though?

name: stuart
text:
AAAAAAAAAAAAA!
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHH!!

name: honesttom
text: ... said Stuart's avatar.

name: stuart
text: Which is just my own salutory head, actually. Below it I'm doing the whole "gun fingahs" thing.

name: mygoodfriend
text: He'd just look you in the eye and know that you lied.

name: cailetshadow
text: Nice Pete does not see a significant difference between the Bible and his Bible fan fiction.

name: notcool
text:
Kinda like people who write Harry Potter fanfic.

Nice Pete kinda misses the entire point of the Bible.

Kinda like people who write Harry Potter fanfic.

name: dasilodavi
text: Once one shuffles off the mortal coil the rants of a murdering lunatic are not taken with fear or subservience.

name: satellitetv
text: I was hoping someone would've posted their own bible fan fiction in response to this.

name: nikopol
text:
Ask and ye shall recieve: http://community.livejournal.com/bible_slash/

be careful what you wish for.

name: satellitetv
text:
Oh man that is mega nasty

that is dog shit

name: nikopol
text: And that, my friends, is why there is no diaper bigger than the internet.

name: rykan
text:
Bible... Slash?

There is no god.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Or at least you don't want to hear about his particular fetishes.

name: rowboat
text: Nice Pete's bible fan fiction has almost nothing in common with the work of Stephen King, but it is virtually ripped straight out of And The Ass Saw The Angel. I remember something to this effect being mentioned in a prior strip, but the fourth panel really drives it home.

name: sp1derbaby
text: That's what it reminded me of too.

name: caseyb3
text: Bible fanfiction doesn't have to be this bad. The Book of Mormon was a marvelous work and a wonder, after all - it says so right in the Book of Mormon!

name: sandswipe
text: It had high points, but it hated on the booze too much, and was a little too implausible with the whole hat thing.

name: alzuna
text: I'd give you a chubby but I've heard that one enough (I live in Utah, you can imagine...) just not find it funny anymore. But you don't get a lame either, so, win-win .

name: alzuna
text: Man, I was thinking about it and that comment I made is just rude, sorry. The question is, did I even need to write it? No, no I didn't.

name: mattylite
text: "did I even need to write it?"-- come on, this is the internet.  If everyone asked themselves this question it'd just be the WebMD and Municipal Softball League net.

name: alzuna
text:
Too true, but in a moment of internet rage a smart person would stop and question if they really would like that rude thought immortalized for all to see.

[insert cleverly worded sweeping generalization of internet users and their intelligence being low and that is why the internet is the way it is here]

name: sp1derbaby
text: I believe the only words you need are "Youtube comment section."

name: trumbot
text: It takes a lot to get Todd to tell you to ease up on someone.

name: jawsh
text: imagine someone saying panel 6 in one of those DnD nerd voices when someone criticizes his fanfic about a forbidden elf/drawf relationship

name: direhaggis
text: Nice Pete has a slight lack of grammer and rhyming going on in his fan fiction.

name: mattylite
text: But his spellang is fine.

name: direhaggis
text: And apparently mine was not. It appears I have been powerfully consigned to chicken-wire by a trademarked mascot.

name: mattylite
text: Truth be told I remember losing a spelling bee the same way.  For real.

name: zedpower
text: Any mortal can kill, but it takes God to CONSIGN UNTO MURDER.

name: mc_white
text: Blister's badass with his insults. Dude should be on what not to wear

name: ketelcat
text: Philippe, Philippe, Philippe. The saddest thing is a hack pretending to want contstructive criticism.

name: tripperday
text: Blister kind of steals the show here, but doesn't anyone else appreciate the genius of Bible fan fiction? (Besides Dan Brown)

name: daaaaang
text: I know that everybody says this, but I still love that Blister is always holding out his arms like he is speaking in the dreams of a prophet
